processed.result: You have a network of cities connected by roads.  Some roads are bad.  You need to figure out how many ways you can fix some roads so that from any city, you can reach the capital city with at most one bad road along the way.  You need to do this for each city as a possible capital.

There are $n$ cities and $n-1$ roads connecting them.  Each road connects two cities.  You need to determine, for each city $i$ (where $1 \le i \le n$), the number of ways to improve some of the roads so that:

*  The capital city is city $i$.
*  Every path from the capital city to any other city has at most one bad road.

The number of ways to improve the roads should be calculated modulo $10^9 + 7$.
